patient_summary.visit_summary: You visited today because your doctor wanted to check on how you're feeling since your last visit. The main finding is that your blood sugar levels are higher than usual, and you've gained weight. You'll need to work on improving your diet and increasing physical activity, and the doctor will follow up with you in three months.

medications.name: metformin
medications.instructions: Take as prescribed by your doctor
medications.evidence: You're currently taking metformin 1000 milligrams twice daily, correct?

medications.name: GLP1 medication
medications.instructions: Take as prescribed by your doctor
medications.evidence: I'd also like to add a GLP1 medication to help with both sugar and weight.

tests_ordered.evidence: We should check your A1C and kidney function today.
We should check your A1C and kidney function today.

follow_up_plan.evidence: Okay. We'll follow up in three months.

follow_up_plan.action: Call of sugars go above 250 or feel dizzy
follow_up_plan.date_or_timeline: when blood sugar levels exceed 250 or you feel dizzy
follow_up_plan.evidence: Call of sugars go above 250 or you feel dizzy

lifestyle_recommendations.recommendation: Improve diet and increase physical activity
lifestyle_recommendations.details: Eat a balanced diet and aim for at least 30 minutes of walking daily
lifestyle_recommendations.evidence: How's your diet? Not great. I eat rice almost every meal.

lifestyle_recommendations.details: Aim for at least 30 minutes of walking daily
lifestyle_recommendations.evidence: Also increase walking to 30 minutes daily

red_flags_for_patient.warning: Symptoms of high blood sugar: excessive thirst, weight gain, blurred vision
red_flags_for_patient.evidence: I'm thirsty all the time. I actually gained around five pounds in the last three months.

red_flags_for_patient.warning: Symptoms of kidney problems: frequent urination at night, numbness or tingling in feet
red_flags_for_patient.evidence: You've been waking up at night to urinate. Sometimes at night. We should check your A1C and kidney function today.

questions_and_answers.question: What's the best way to manage my blood sugar levels?
questions_and_answers.answer: Work on improving your diet and increasing physical activity, and take your medications as prescribed
questions_and_answers.evidence: We'll have you meet with nutrition counseling. Also increase walking to 30 minutes daily.

findings: waking up at night to urinate
gained around five pounds in the last three months
evidence: I've been okay, but I still feel tired most afternoons. And I've been waking up at night to urinate.
